byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman reported from Washington, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and KEITH BRADSHER

abstract: Michael B Froman, United States trade representative, announces Obama administration will file case with World Trade Organization accusing China of illegally subsidizing industries aimed at export market; announcement is both meant for Beijing and Congress, where Pres Obama is pushing for more authority in negotiating trade deals like Trans-Pacific Partnership.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration accused China of providing almost $1 billion in illegal subsidies over three years by providing so-called common service platforms to aid exporters.

headline.main: White House to File Case Against China at W.T.O. Over Subsidies for Exports
headline.print_headline: White House to File Case Against China at W.T.O. Over Subsidies for Exports

snippet: The Obama administration accused China of providing almost $1 billion in illegal subsidies over three years by providing so-called common service platforms to aid exporters.
